operations.specification:
This operation deletes a specific enrollment record identified by the enrollment ID in the Enterprise Learning Management System (LMS). The deletion performed is a soft delete as the Prisma schema includes a nullable 'deleted_at' timestamp to indicate soft deletion status. The enrollment remains in the database but is marked as deleted and excluded from active queries.

This endpoint requires the enrollment ID as a path parameter to pinpoint the enrollment to delete. The operation ensures tenant data isolation and protection by enforcing proper authorization. Only authorized roles can perform deletions to maintain data integrity and compliance.

Under the hood, the delete action sets the 'deleted_at' timestamp to the current timestamp, marking the record as logically deleted.

The corresponding Prisma DB table is 'enterprise_lms_enrollments'.

Authorization roles include systemAdmin, organizationAdmin, and departmentManager, reflecting the security requirements for managing enrollment deletions.
operations.description:
Soft delete an enrollment by ID in the Enterprise LMS. The deleted_at timestamp is set to indicate logical deletion and exclude the enrollment from active records.

This protects data integrity and complies with retention policies by preserving historic enrollment data while marking it inactive.

Tenant context and authorization roles systemAdmin, organizationAdmin, and departmentManager are enforced.

No response body is returned; success is indicated by HTTP status codes only.
operations.summary: Soft delete an enrollment by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the enrollment to delete (soft delete)

The certificate issuance table tracks issue dates, expiration dates, statuses, and business workflow states, and is linked to learners and certifications in a multi-tenant context.

Security considerations include enforcing tenant and user access controls to ensure confidentiality of learner certification data. Only authorized roles such as systemAdmin and organizationAdmin should access this endpoint.

This operation relates to the enterprise_lms_certificate_issuances table and returns comprehensive certificate issuance data needed for compliance reporting, learner dashboards, or audit trails.

operations.description:
Delete a specific certificate issuance record by ID.

This operation permanently removes a certificate issuance record. It is used for revoking or cleaning up certification data that is no longer valid or required within the Enterprise LMS.

Because the enterprise_lms_certificate_issuances table does not implement soft delete fields, this action irreversibly removes the record from the database.

Proper authorization is required to prevent unauthorized data loss. System admin and organization admin roles are permitted.

If the record does not exist, a 404 Not Found error is returned.

Clients should handle this deletion carefully due to its irreversible nature.

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a filtered and paginated list of content access control entries from the Enterprise Learning Management System (LMS). It operates on the enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table as defined in the Prisma schema. The API supports complex searching, filtering, sorting, and pagination on access control entities, which define visibility and permissions of content items to specific roles and learners within tenants. This allows clients to retrieve relevant content access rules enforced by the system, facilitating auditing and display of access policies for tenant administrators and authorized users.
operations.description:
This API endpoint enables retrieval of content access control entries with sophisticated query capabilities. Clients can filter based on tenant organization, specific content items, or role-based and learner-specific permissions. The content access controls govern which roles or individual learners have access to particular content items across tenant boundaries, crucial for enforcing multi-tenant data security.

The endpoint uses a PATCH method to accept complex request parameters encapsulated in a request DTO, allowing for comprehensive search queries including pagination and sorting options. By returning a paginated list of access controls, the operation supports efficient client-side rendering and management of access policies.

Security measures ensure that only users with appropriate administrative permissions can query access control entries. This avoids exposing sensitive access rules to unauthorized users.

The response contains summarized data optimized for list displays and further exploration.

Relationships to the underlying enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table and connected tenant and content entities are honored, ensuring data integrity and consistency.
operations.summary: Search and retrieve a filtered, paginated list of content access controls

requestBody.description: Search criteria and pagination parameters for content access control filtering

responseBody.description: Paginated list of content access control summary information matching search criteria

operations.name: search

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves detailed information about a specific content access control entry identified by its unique ID. It operates on the enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table from the Enterprise Learning Management System (LMS) schema. The API provides comprehensive information about visibility rules for a content item within a tenant, specifying which roles and individual learners have access.

The GET method accepts a path parameter 'id' that uniquely identifies the content access control record. The response returns the main entity with all attributes, enabling clients to inspect the full access control configuration.

Authorization is limited to organization administrators who manage tenant-wide access policies.
operations.description:
This GET endpoint fetches a single content access control by unique identifier. It returns detailed data including allowed roles, allowed learner IDs, and metadata timestamps. This enables authorized users to review or audit specific content access permissions.

The operation strictly enforces data isolation and access control by tenant context and user role, preventing unauthorized access to access control configurations.

It retrieves information directly from the enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table, maintaining integrity and consistency.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the content access control

operations.specification:
This operation creates a new content access control entry within the Enterprise Learning Management System (LMS). It inserts a new record into the enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table, establishing which roles and individual learners have permission to access specific content items for a tenant.

The POST method accepts a request body containing creation information including tenant ID, content ID, allowed roles, and allowed learners. The system validates the uniqueness and referential integrity constraints before saving.

Only organization administrators are authorized to create access control entries, ensuring control over tenant content visibility and security policies.

The response returns the newly created content access control entity with all properties populated.
operations.description:
This POST endpoint allows creation of a new content access control record, defining specific access permissions at the content item level within a tenant. It supports detailed role and learner assignments to tightly govern content visibility and access in multi-tenant scenarios.

The operation enforces validation of input parameters and checks for unique constraints on content and tenant combinations.

Proper authorization checks ensure only privileged users can assign access controls.

Upon success, the newly created access control record is returned with full detail, enabling client applications to confirm creation and display the configuration.

requestBody.description: Creation info of the content access control entry

responseBody.description: The created content access control record

This operation updates an existing content access control entry identified by its unique ID within the Enterprise Learning Management System (LMS). It operates on the enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table.

The PUT method accepts a path parameter 'id' to identify the specific record and a request body containing update information including modification of allowed roles and allowed learners for the content item. The system validates changes and preserves data integrity.

Authorization is restricted to organization administrators with permission to manage tenant-wide content access policies.

The response returns the updated content access control entity reflecting all changes.
operations.description:
This PUT endpoint modifies an existing content access control entry identified by ID. It enables updating role and learner permissions related to specific content.

The operation ensures strict authorization and validation before applying changes to prevent unauthorized or conflicting updates.

It integrates directly with the underlying enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table and tenant context, maintaining consistency.

Returns the updated access control record for client verification.

It permanently removes the entry from the enterprise_lms_content_access_controls table, which manages content visibility permissions for roles and learners within tenant organizations. This DELETE endpoint requires an 'id' path parameter which is the UUID of the targeted content access control record. Authorization is restricted to systemAdmin role users with appropriate permissions.
operations.description:
Permanently delete a content access control record identified by its unique ID.

This operation removes the access control rule from the system immediately. Since the table supports soft deletion with a deleted_at column, this endpoint implements a hard delete, fully erasing the record.

Only system administrators are authorized to perform this action to ensure secure management of access control policies within the LMS.

The endpoint integrates directly with enterprise_lms_content_access_controls Prisma entity, ensuring tenant-scoped access control management aligns with system security policies.

Use caution as this deletion cannot be undone and affects content access behavior system-wide.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the content access control record to be deleted

operations.specification: This operation retrieves detailed progress tracking information for a specific record by its UUID unique identifier from the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table. The record contains metrics such as time spent, assessment attempts, and engagement score for a learner's interaction with content. The GET endpoint uses the 'id' path parameter specifying the record's UUID.
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a learner's progress tracking by its unique ID.

This endpoint returns metrics including time spent (seconds), assessment attempts, and engagement score related to the learner's interaction with specific content.

Access control ensures only authorized learners or system-level users can retrieve the data.

The operation corresponds to the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking Prisma table, critical for monitoring learner engagement and progress analytics.

Proper error handling is implemented for cases such as non-existent IDs or insufficient permissions.

It records details such as time spent, assessment attempts, and engagement score, conforming to the schema defined in IEnterpriseLmsProgressTracking.ICreate. The POST endpoint accepts these details in the request body and returns the newly created progress tracking record.
operations.description:
Create a new progress tracking record for a learner's content interaction.

The endpoint accepts progress metrics including time spent (seconds), number of assessment attempts, and engagement score. The request body must adhere to the IEnterpriseLmsProgressTracking.ICreate schema.

Upon successful creation, the full progress tracking record is returned.

Authorization ensures only authenticated corporate learners can create records tied to their own data.

This operation interfaces directly with the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table in the database schema.

operations.specification: This operation searches progress tracking entries using filter and pagination parameters defined in IEnterpriseLmsProgressTracking.IRequest. It retrieves paginated summaries of progress data from the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table, enabling analysis of learner engagement metrics with support for filtering, sorting, and pagination.
operations.description:
Search and retrieve a filtered, paginated list of progress tracking entries.

This endpoint supports complex queries including filtering by learner, content, time range, and engagement metrics. It returns paginated summaries to optimize frontend performance.

Authorization ensures users can only query data within their tenant and permission scope.

The operation corresponds to the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table and supports analytics and reporting features.

Errors related to invalid filters or unauthorized access are managed appropriately.

requestBody.description: Filter and pagination parameters for progress tracking

operations.specification: This operation updates an existing learner's progress tracking record identified by its unique ID, updating fields such as time spent, assessment attempts, and engagement score. It operates on the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table which stores detailed metrics of learner engagement and learning progress per content. This API requires the client to provide the ID of the progress tracking record and the update data in IEnterpriseLmsProgressTracking.IUpdate format. The response returns the updated progress tracking record. Only authorized users with role 'corporateLearner' should be allowed to perform this update, ensuring proper access control and data integrity.
operations.description:
Update an existing learner's progress tracking record by its unique ID. This operation modifies key learning metrics including time spent on content, number of assessment attempts, and engagement score, reflecting the learner's evolving progress.

Security and access control require that only authenticated users with the 'corporateLearner' role can perform updates.

This method involves the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table according to the Prisma schema, which links learners with content items and tracks detailed interaction data.

Validation rules ensure the ID path parameter is a valid UUID and the update payload conforms to the defined DTO IEnterpriseLmsProgressTracking.IUpdate.

On success, the updated progress tracking record is returned with all relevant data fields like learnerId, contentId, and engagement metrics.

Error handling includes proper responses for invalid IDs, authorization errors, and validation failures.
operations.summary: Update a specific progress tracking record by ID

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the progress tracking record

requestBody.description: Data to update progress tracking record

operations.name: updateProgressTracking

operations.specification:
This operation deletes an existing learner's progress tracking record identified by its unique ID from the database. It operates on the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table which holds detailed learner engagement metrics. Since the schema supports a deleted_at soft delete timestamp, this deletion marks the record as deleted rather than permanently removing it. This ensures historical data remains for audit and compliance purposes.

This API requires the ID of the progress tracking record in the path parameter. No request body is needed.

Only authorized users with role 'corporateLearner' can perform this deletion.

The operation returns no content on success but must handle error cases such as non-existent IDs or unauthorized access appropriately.
operations.description:
Permanently or logically delete a learner's progress tracking record by its ID. Since the schema includes a deleted_at field, this operation performs a soft delete by setting the deleted_at timestamp.

Only users with role 'corporateLearner' are authorized to perform this action.

The record identified by the provided UUID in the path parameter is marked as deleted, preserving data for audit compliance.

This operation interfaces with the enterprise_lms_progress_tracking table in the Prisma schema.
operations.summary: Delete a specific progress tracking record by ID (soft delete)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the progress tracking record

operations.name: eraseProgressTracking

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves a paginated list of compliance records for learners across tenant organizations, supporting filtering, sorting, and pagination. It interfaces with the enterprise_lms_compliance_records table, which stores detailed compliance audit data including types, statuses, and compliance-related notes for learners. The client submits complex filtering criteria in the IEnterpriseLmsComplianceRecords.IRequest request body. The response returns paginated compliance record summaries with relevant compliance info.

Only authorized users with 'organizationAdmin' role should access this endpoint due to sensitivity of compliance data.

The response excludes deleted records and supports robust error handling for validation and authorization.
operations.description:
Retrieve a filtered, sorted, and paginated list of learner compliance records. This operation supports querying by compliance type, status, learner identifiers, and date ranges.

Access is restricted to users with administrative privileges ('organizationAdmin' role).

The data source is the enterprise_lms_compliance_records table, which tracks regulatory compliance status and audit records for learners.

The request body parameters define search filters and pagination options, while the response body includes a paginated summary list of compliance records.

Proper validation is enforced to ensure valid query criteria and consistent pagination.
operations.summary: Search and retrieve compliance records with filtering and pagination

requestBody.description: Search criteria and pagination parameters for compliance records

responseBody.description: Paginated compliance record summaries matching search criteria

operations.name: searchComplianceRecords

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves detailed information for a compliance record identified by its unique ID. It fetches data from the enterprise_lms_compliance_records database, including compliance type, status, detailed notes, and timestamps. The ID is supplied as a path parameter and must be a valid UUID.

Access to this endpoint requires the 'corporateLearner' role, ensuring that only authenticated users can view compliance record details. The operation returns full compliance record details or appropriate errors for unauthorized access or missing records.

This GET method has no request body and returns a detailed IEnterpriseLmsComplianceRecords response.
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific compliance record by its unique identifier.

This operation fetches compliance status, types, and audit details stored in enterprise_lms_compliance_records.

Only authorized users with role 'corporateLearner' can access this information.

Validates path parameter ID as a UUID and returns comprehensive compliance record data on success.

Handles errors appropriately for non-existent or unauthorized requests.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the compliance record

authorization.name: systemAdmin
authorization.description: Full system access across all organizations, server configuration, global analytics, integration management, and API administration.

authorization.name: organizationAdmin
authorization.description: Complete control within their organization including user management, role assignment, content approval, organization settings, and financial reporting.

authorization.name: departmentManager
authorization.description: Manages users within their department, assigns and tracks content, monitors department analytics, and approves budgets for paid content.

authorization.name: contentCreatorInstructor
authorization.description: Creates courses and content, monitors student progress, manages grading and feedback, with limited analytics access on their content.

authorization.name: corporateLearner
authorization.description: Enrolled employee with access to assigned courses, progress tracking, certification download, discussion participation, and personal dashboard.

authorization.name: externalLearner
authorization.description: Limited access to public and paid courses with payment capabilities, basic progress tracking, and community feature participation.

authorization.name: guest
authorization.description: Browse public course catalogs with no enrollment rights; anonymous analytics tracking enabled.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

pages.description:
Total pages.

Equal to {@link records} / {@link limit} with ceiling.

access.description:
JWT access token for authenticated requests.

This token should be included in the Authorization header for subsequent
authenticated API requests as `Bearer {token}`.

refresh.description:
Refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.

This token can be used to request new access tokens when the current access
token expires, extending the user's session.

expired_at.description:
Access token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating when the access token will expire and
can no longer be used for authentication.

refreshable_until.description:
Refresh token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating the latest time until which the
refresh token can be used to obtain new access tokens.

IAuthorizationToken.description:
Authorization token response structure.

This interface defines the structure of the authorization token response
returned after successful user authentication. It contains both access and
refresh tokens along with their expiration information.

This token structure is automatically included in API schemas when the system
detects authorization roles in the requirements analysis phase. It provides a
standard format for JWT-based authentication across the generated backend
applications.

IEnterpriseLmsSystemAdmin.description:
Main entity representing a system Administrator within the Enterprise LMS platform.

The system admin has full access across all organizations including server maintenance, global analytics, integration management, and API administration.
Data is isolated by tenant ID, with secure credential storage and soft deletion support.

@namespace EnterpriseLmsSystemAdmin

id.description: Primary Key - unique identifier for the system admin user.

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization unique identifier (UUID) to which the user belongs.

email.description: Unique email address for login and communications.

password_hash.description: Hashed password for authentication stored securely.

first_name.description: First name of the system administrator.

last_name.description: Last name of the system administrator.

status.description: Current status of the system administrator account (e.g., active, suspended).

created_at.description: Timestamp when the record was created (ISO 8601).

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the record was last updated (ISO 8601).

deleted_at.description: Nullable soft deletion timestamp - null means active.

last_name.description: Last name of the system administrator.

IEnterpriseLmsOrganizationAdmin.description:
Organization Administrator users who manage users, roles, content
approval, configurations, and billing within their own organization.
Tenant-isolated for data security.

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization identifier (UUID).

email.description: Email address for the account (must be unique within tenant).

password.description: Plaintext password; will be hashed securely by the server.

first_name.description: First name for organizational identification

last_name.description: Last name for organizational identification

status.description: User status, if required.

IEnterpriseLmsOrganizationAdmin.ICreate.description:
Request body to create a new organization administrator user.

Includes tenant ID, email, plaintext password to be hashed, first/last name.
The system will assign status defaults and timestamps.

Sensitive fields like 'deleted_at' or 'status' typically handled internally.

NOTE: 'password_hash' is hashed at back-end; client request contains plain password.

Email and plaintext password required for credential verification.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token string for renewing session access.

Request body to refresh JWT tokens.

Contains refresh token string obtained from prior authentication.

Tenant organization identifier.

References the tenant organization this administrator belongs to.

email.description: User's email address previously used for login and communications.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for secure authentication.

Stored as a hashed string; never expose or accept in plain text.

first_name.description: First name of the authorized user.

last_name.description: Last name of the authorized user.

status.description: Current account status (e.g., active, suspended).

created_at.description:
Record creation timestamp.

Format: ISO 8601 date-time string.

updated_at.description:
Record last update timestamp.

Format: ISO 8601 date-time string.

deleted_at.description:
Optional soft delete timestamp.

Nullable ISO 8601 date-time string; null means not deleted.

IEnterpriseLmsOrganizationAdmin.IAuthori.description:
Authorization response for organization administrator.

Includes user ID, email, name, current status, and JWT token info.

Tokens include access and refresh tokens managed by the system.

tenant_id.description: Tenant identifier.

first_name.description: First name.

last_name.description: Last name.

updated_at.description: Updated timestamp as ISO date-time string.

deleted_at.description:
Optional deleted timestamp.

Nullable ISO date-time string.

IEnterpriseLmsPaymentTransaction.description: Records of payment processing transactions related to course purchases, subscriptions, and certifications within the Enterprise LMS. This model captures details including transaction amounts, currencies, methods, statuses, timestamps, and relevant references to external payment gateways and users. It supports auditing and financial reconciliation workflows, ensuring traceability and regulatory compliance.

Hashed password for authentication.

User's personal given name.

User's family name.

Typically used to enable/disable login or access.

IEnterpriseLmsExternalLearner.description:
Enterprise LMS external learner user entity.

Represents individual external learners with limited access to public and paid courses.

Supports multi-tenant isolation and user lifecycle management.

Includes authentication credential hashes and status management.

limit.description: Limitation of records per page

search.description: Search string to filter external learners

status.description: Filter by account status (e.g., active, suspended)

tenant_id.description: Filter by tenant organization ID

IEnterpriseLmsExternalLearner.IRequest.description: Request payload for searching or filtering external learners with optional pagination and tenant filtering.

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization UUID.
This is required to associate the new external learner.

email.description:
Unique email address for login.
Must be unique within this tenant.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for authentication.
Expect the hashed string as input.

first_name.description:
First name of the external learner.
Required for personalization and displays.

last_name.description:
Last name of the external learner.
Required for personalization and displays.

status.description:
Current status of the external learner account.
Typical statuses: 'active', 'pending', 'suspended'.
Must be one of the enumerated statuses.

IEnterpriseLmsExternalLearner.ICreate.description:
Payload to create a new Enterprise LMS external learner user.

Includes all required fields to register a new external learner,
ensuring tenant association and initial account status.

email.description:
Unique email address for login.
Should be unique within tenant. Optional during update.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for authentication.
Optional; update if password change is required.

first_name.description:
First name of the external learner.
Optional.

last_name.description:
Last name of the external learner.
Optional.

status.description:
Status of the external learner account.
Optional; update for activation/deactivation.
Must respect enum constraints if updated.

deleted_at.description:
Soft delete timestamp or null.
Optional; null means active, ISO 8601 string or null.

IEnterpriseLmsExternalLearner.IUpdate.description:
Payload for updating an existing Enterprise LMS external learner user.

All fields are optional, allowing partial updates.
Supports soft deletion control via deleted_at.
Must comply with tenant data isolation and validation.

IEnterpriseLmsContentVersion.description:
Historical snapshot representing a specific version of content for audit, rollback, or compliance tracking.

Each version provides details about the state of the content at a certain point in time, preserving historical information for traceability.

limit.description: Limit of how many approval steps to return per request for performance optimization.

sort.description: Sort order criteria for approval step search results.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the approval step record was last updated.

step_number.description: The order of the approval step in the workflow.

reviewer_role.description: Role responsible for reviewing this step, e.g., organizationAdmin.

step_number.description: The order of the approval step in the workflow.

reviewer_role.description: Role responsible for reviewing this step, e.g., organizationAdmin.

id.description: Primary key UUID

created_at.description: Timestamp when the localization was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the localization was last updated

IEnterpriseLmsContentLocalization.description:
Content localization entity representing language-specific titles and descriptions linked to content items within the Enterprise LMS.

Supports multi-language content management by capturing localized fields per language code.

Includes audit information with creation and update timestamps.

content_id.description: Reference to the primary content item. UUID format.

language_code.description: ISO 639-1 language code such as 'en' for English

localized_title.description: Optional localized title in the given language

localized_description.description: Optional localized description in the given language

IEnterpriseLmsContentLocalization.ICreat.description:
Create payload for adding a new content localization record.

Includes mandatory content reference and language code with optional localized title and description fields.

Used for multi-language enhancements of training content.

IEnterpriseLmsContentLocalization.IUpdat.description:
Update payload for content localization.

Allows modification of localized title and description fields only.

Immutable fields like id, content_id and language_code are excluded from updates.

search.description: Search text typically used in code, name or description fields

code.description: Filter by exact or partial code match

name.description: Filter by partial or full name match

description.description: Filter by partial or full description

page.description: Page number for pagination starting from 1

limit.description: Limit records per page

IEnterpriseLmsContentTag.IRequest.description:
Request for filtering and paginating content tags.

Includes search text and filters on code, name, and description.

Supports pagination via page and limit fields.

Allows ordering results by a specified property and direction.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the content tag.

code.description:
Unique identifying code for the tag.

This code is used as the primary reference for the tag entity in the system.

name.description:
Display name of the tag.

This is the human-readable name used in the application UI and content categorization.

description.description:
Optional descriptive information about the tag's purpose.

Provides additional context and information to administrators and users.

IEnterpriseLmsContentTag.description:
Content tag entity used to classify and organize materials within the Enterprise LMS.

Each tag possesses a unique code and human-readable name, optionally accompanied by a descriptive text to aid in content categorization and discovery.

code.description:
Unique identifying code for the tag.

Required when creating a new content tag. Must be unique.

name.description:
Display name of the tag.

Required when creating a new content tag.

description.description:
Optional descriptive information about the tag's purpose.

Null or omitted when not provided.

IEnterpriseLmsContentTag.ICreate.description:
Request payload for creating a new content tag.

Includes mandatory code and name properties, with optional description to provide further context.

code.description:
Unique identifying code for the tag.

Optional for updates; must maintain uniqueness if provided.

name.description:
Display name of the tag.

Optional for updates.

description.description:
Optional descriptive information about the tag's purpose.

Nullable to allow clearing or setting description.

IEnterpriseLmsContentTag.IUpdate.description:
Request payload for updating an existing content tag.

Allows partial update with optional code, name, and description properties, all nullable for clear setting of values.

search.description:
Filter parameters for paginated search of child tags under a parent tag.

Supports pagination, sorting, and filtering by child tag attributes.

page.description:
Page number for pagination.

Optional. If not provided, defaults applied.

limit.description:
Number of records per page.

Optional. Defaults may apply.

sort.description:
Sort order specifier.

Optional string indicating the sort criteria (e.g., 'name asc').

IEnterpriseLmsContentTagChild.IRequest.description:
Search criteria and pagination parameters for querying child content tags under a given parent tag.

Facilitates filtering, sorting, and paginating within hierarchical content tag structures.

id.description: Primary key representing the unique identifier of the child tag relationship

parent_tag_id.description: Reference to the parent content tag entity

child_tag_id.description: Reference to the child content tag entity

created_at.description: Timestamp when the parent-child relation was established

IEnterpriseLmsContentTagChild.description:
Child content tag relationship entity representing a link between a parent tag and a child tag in the hierarchical content classification system.

This entity defines the parent-child tag association enabling complex tag taxonomies within a tenant-scoped environment.

Properties include unique IDs for the relationship and references to parent and child tags alongside the relation creation timestamp.

This schema supports efficient querying and management of content tag hierarchies, enforcing tenant data isolation and providing foundational structure for content classification.

parent_tag_id.description: Unique identifier referencing the parent tag to associate this hierarchy with

child_tag_id.description: Unique identifier referencing the child tag to associate as subordinate to the parent tag

IEnterpriseLmsContentTagHierarchy.ICreat.description:
Input payload for creating a content tag hierarchy relationship.

It requires parent and child tag identifiers as UUIDs establishing the hierarchical link between tags.

This creation operation is essential for managing content taxonomy relationships and enforces consistency by ensuring referenced tag IDs exist within the tenant scope.

parent_tag_id.description: Optional update of the parent tag reference; can be null to remove relationship

child_tag_id.description: Optional update of the child tag reference; can be null to remove relationship

IEnterpriseLmsContentTagHierarchy.IUpdat.description:
Input schema for updating a content tag hierarchy relationship.

Allows optional reassignment or removal of parent or child tag references within the hierarchical tag taxonomy.

Nullable fields permit flexibility in managing tag hierarchy adjustments without full replacement.

id.description: Unique identifier of the content tag hierarchy relationship

parent_tag_id.description: The identifier of the parent tag in this hierarchical relationship

child_tag_id.description: The identifier of the child tag in this hierarchical relationship

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this parent-child tag relation was created

IEnterpriseLmsContentTagHierarchy.description:
Represents the hierarchical relationship linking parent and child content tags within the enterprise learning management system.

Maintains data integrity by capturing explicit foreign key references to the parent and child tags.

Supports querying hierarchies for content classification and enables fine-grained content organization.

Essential part of complex content taxonomies ensuring data isolation and integrity within multi-tenant environments.

limit.description:
Number of items per page.

@default 100

search.description: Search text to be matched against code or title of learning paths.

status.description: Optional status filter (e.g., active, inactive, archived).

orderBy.description: Field to sort the results by.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPath.IRequest.description: Request type for searching and filtering learning paths with pagination and sorting support.

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the learning path

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization UUID that owns this learning path

code.description: Unique code identifying this learning path within the tenant

description.description: Optional detailed description of the learning path

status.description: Current lifecycle status of the learning path (e.g., active, inactive, archived)

created_at.description: Timestamp when the learning path record was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the learning path record was last updated.

deleted_at.description:
Nullable timestamp marking soft deletion of the record.

Null indicates active record.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPaths.description:
Learning path entity representing a sequence of training modules or courses for a tenant organization.

Includes properties necessary for managing lifecycle state, tenant ownership, and content sequencing within the Enterprise LMS solution.

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization UUID to associate with this learning path.

Required to enforce multi-tenant data isolation.

code.description:
Code uniquely identifying the learning path within the tenant.

Must be unique per tenant.

title.description:
Title of the learning path.

Must be a descriptive name.

description.description:
Optional detailed description providing additional context.

Can be null if not provided.

status.description:
Initial status of the learning path lifecycle.

Typical values: 'active', 'inactive', 'archived'.

Must exactly match allowed enum values.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPaths.ICreate.description: Schema for creating a new learning path in the Enterprise LMS system. Requires tenant association and business identifiers.

code.description:
Optional updated code for the learning path.

Must conform to uniqueness constraint within tenant if changed.

title.description:
Optional updated title.

Useful for correcting or improving display names.

description.description:
Optional updated description.

Can be null to clear the description.

status.description:
Optional updated lifecycle status.

Must exactly match the allowed lifecycle status enum values.

deleted_at.description:
Optional updated soft deletion timestamp.

Setting to null means record is active, else indicates deleted.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPaths.IUpdate.description: Schema for updating an existing learning path in the Enterprise LMS system. All fields are optional to support partial updates.

limit.description: Pagination: items per page.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPathItem.IRequest.description: Request parameters for searching and pagination of learning path items.

id.description: Unique identifier of the learning path item.

item_type.description: The type of the item (course, module, assessment, etc.).

item_id.description: Identifier of the actual content or assessment this item references.

sequence_order.description: The position of this item within the learning path.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp of soft deletion. Null means active.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPathItem.description:
Entity representing an item in a learning path such as a course, module, or assessment.


This entity includes all details required to track position, associated content, and status within the learning path.
Deleted items are soft deleted using a deletion timestamp.

learning_path_id.description:
Learning path to which this item belongs.

Required and must be a UUID.

item_id.description: Identifier of the content or assessment linked to this item.

sequence_order.description: Sequence order of the item within the learning path.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPathItem.ICreate.description: Creation parameters for a new learning path item. Requires learning_path_id, item_type, item_id, and sequence_order.

deleted_at.description: Optional updated deleted_at timestamp for soft deletion.

IEnterpriseLmsLearningPathItem.IUpdate.description: Update parameters for an existing learning path item. All fields are optional.

oneOf.description:
Filter by certification code (exact or partial match).

This field can be used to limit results to certifications matching the specified code criteria.

code.description:
Filter by certification code (exact or partial match).

This field can be used to limit results to certifications matching the specified code criteria.

oneOf.description:
Filter by certification name (partial or exact match).

Allows clients to search certifications by their display names, enabling flexible lookup.

name.description:
Filter by certification name (partial or exact match).

Allows clients to search certifications by their display names, enabling flexible lookup.

oneOf.description:
Status filter (active, deprecated, retired).

Filters certifications by their lifecycle status to distinguish available or deprecated programs.

status.description:
Status filter (active, deprecated, retired).

Filters certifications by their lifecycle status to distinguish available or deprecated programs.

oneOf.description:
Search keywords for description or other text fields.

Enables fuzzy text searching over certification descriptions or related text properties.

search.description:
Search keywords for description or other text fields.

Enables fuzzy text searching over certification descriptions or related text properties.

oneOf.description:
Pagination: requested page number (positive integer).

The numerical request for pagination, typically starting from 1.

page.description:
Pagination: requested page number (positive integer).

The numerical request for pagination, typically starting from 1.

oneOf.description:
Pagination: number of records per page (positive integer).

Controls the maximum number of records returned per page.

limit.description:
Pagination: number of records per page (positive integer).

Controls the maximum number of records returned per page.

oneOf.description:
Sorting fields - comma separated list e.g. "name asc, created_at desc".

Determines the sort order of returned certification records.

orderBy.description:
Sorting fields - comma separated list e.g. "name asc, created_at desc".

Determines the sort order of returned certification records.

IEnterpriseLmsCertification.IRequest.description:
Request type for searching certifications with filters and pagination.

Contains optional fields for filtering by code, name, and status, as well as search keywords,
with pagination and sorting support.

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization this certification belongs to.

Must be a valid UUID identifying the tenant.

code.description:
Unique code for this certification within the tenant.

Must be unique to prevent duplication.

name.description:
Name of the certification program.

Human-readable name used for display.

oneOf.description:
Optional description providing details about the certification.

Multi-paragraph text is supported.

description.description:
Optional description providing details about the certification.

Multi-paragraph text is supported.

status.description:
Lifecycle status (e.g., active, deprecated, retired)

Indicates availability and validity.

IEnterpriseLmsCertification.ICreate.description:
Payload for creating a new certification record.

Includes essential identification fields and metadata for establishing a certification program within a tenant organization.

code.description:
Unique code for this certification within the tenant.

May only be updated if allowed by business rules.

name.description: Name of the certification program.

oneOf.description: Optional description of the certification.

description.description: Optional description of the certification.

status.description: Lifecycle status.

deleted_at.description:
Soft deletion timestamp.

Use explicit null to unset.

IEnterpriseLmsCertification.IUpdate.description:
Payload for updating an existing certification record.

Supports partial updates for modifiable fields while maintaining data integrity and business rules.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the certification record

@format uuid

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization this certification belongs to.

@format uuid

code.description:
Unique code for this certification within the tenant.

This code is used for identification and lookup of certification programs.

name.description:
Name of the certification program.

Human-readable name suitable for display.

oneOf.description:
Detailed description about the certification program.

Optional multi-paragraph text providing the purpose, coverage, and details
of the certification program.

description.description:
Detailed description about the certification program.

Optional multi-paragraph text providing the purpose, coverage, and details
of the certification program.

status.description:
Lifecycle status of the certification (e.g., active, deprecated, retired).

Indicates whether the certification is currently valid for enrollment
and issuance.

created_at.description:
Timestamp this certification record was created.

ISO 8601 date-time string with timezone.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp this certification record was last updated.

ISO 8601 date-time string with timezone.

oneOf.description:
Soft deletion timestamp.

When set, indicates this certification record is deleted/archived.
Null means active record.

deleted_at.description:
Soft deletion timestamp.

When set, indicates this certification record is deleted/archived.
Null means active record.

IEnterpriseLmsCertification.description:
Certification entity representing a certification program within a tenant organization.

Includes unique identifiers, metadata, lifecycle status, and timestamps.

Supports soft deletion through the deleted_at timestamp.

limit.description:
Number of items per page.

@default 20

IEnterpriseLmsCertificationExpiration.IR.description:
Request payload for listing and filtering certification expirations.

Includes pagination parameters and optional filters.

id.description: Primary Key as UUID identifier.

certification_id.description:
Certification ID linked to this expiration policy.
Referenced from the certifications table.

expiration_period_days.description:
Expiration period in days after certificate issuance.
Indicates how long the certification is valid.

renewal_required.description: Indicates if the certification requires renewal after expiration.

notification_period_days.description:
Notification period in days before expiration.
Used to alert learners and admins.

created_at.description: Timestamp when this policy record was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when this policy record was last updated.

IEnterpriseLmsCertificationExpiration.description:
Certification expiration policies define validity periods, renewal requirements, and notification timing for certifications in the Enterprise LMS.

Detailed information for tenant-scoped certification expiration management.

certification_id.description: Certification ID this expiration policy is linked to.

expiration_period_days.description: Expiration period in days after certificate issuance.

renewal_required.description: Specifies whether renewal is required. Must be true or false.

notification_period_days.description: Number of days prior to expiration when notifications are sent.

IEnterpriseLmsCertificationExpiration.IC.description: Request body for creating a new certification expiration policy.

expiration_period_days.description: Expiration period in days after certificate issuance.

notification_period_days.description: Number of days prior to expiration for sending notifications.

IEnterpriseLmsCertificationExpiration.IU.description:
Request body for updating an existing certification expiration policy.
All fields optional to allow partial updates.

tenant_id.description:
Filter by tenant ID.

Optional UUID string.

code.description:
Filter by competency code.

Optional string for partial or exact match.

name.description:
Filter by competency name.

Optional string for partial or exact match.

description.description:
Keywords to search in description.

Optional string for search functionality.

onlyActive.description:
Include only active competencies, i.e., deleted_at must be null.

Optional boolean.

page.description:
Pagination page number.

Optional unsigned integer.

limit.description:
Pagination page size.

Optional unsigned integer.

sort.description:
Sort order.

Optional string. Could be e.g., 'created_at asc' or 'name desc'.

IEnterpriseLmsCompetency.IRequest.description:
Search and filter request for diagnostics related to competencies.

Contains optional properties for tenant filtering, code matching, name searching, and pagination.

id.description:
Unique identifier for a competency.

This is a UUID string uniquely identifying the competency entity.

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization this competency belongs to.

Foreign key UUID reference to tenant, enforcing multi-tenancy.

code.description:
Unique code representing the competency.

This code uniquely identifies competency within a tenant scope.

name.description:
Name of the competency skill or capability.

This is the display name indicative of the competency.

description.description:
Detailed explanation of the competency.

Optional descriptive text providing further details.

created_at.description:
Timestamp representing when competency was created.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string (UTC).

updated_at.description:
Timestamp representing last update time.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string (UTC).

deleted_at.description:
Timestamp representing soft-deletion time.

Nullable column, ISO 8601 date-time string or null if not deleted.

IEnterpriseLmsCompetencies.description:
Competency entity representing skill sets or capabilities within tenant organizations.

Includes unique code, name, description, timestamps, and soft deletion status.

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization this competency belongs to.
Must be a UUID string.

code.description: Unique code representing the competency.

name.description: Name of the competency skill or capability.

description.description:
Optional descriptive explanation.
Nullable and optional.

IEnterpriseLmsCompetencies.ICreate.description:
Create data required to instantiate a new competency entity.

Includes required tenant reference, unique code, and name, with optional description.

tenant_id.description:
Tenant organization this competency belongs to.
Optional UUID string.

While tenant_id is usually immutable, this field is optional for updates.

code.description:
Unique code representing the competency.
Optional on update.

name.description:
Name of the competency skill or capability.
Optional.

description.description:
Optional descriptive explanation.
Nullable.

deleted_at.description:
Soft deletion timestamp.
Nullable.
Allows marking for soft-delete or clear.

IEnterpriseLmsCompetencies.IUpdate.description:
Update payload for modifying a competency entity.

All fields are optional including soft delete timestamp to mark logical deletion or undo it.

session_type.description: Type of session (e.g., online, offline, hybrid).

title.description: Title or name of the blended learning session.

status.description: Current status of the session (e.g., scheduled, completed, cancelled).

scheduled_start_at_from.description: Start timestamp date range filter - from.

scheduled_start_at_to.description: Start timestamp date range filter - to.

scheduled_end_at_from.description: End timestamp date range filter - from.

scheduled_end_at_to.description: End timestamp date range filter - to.

IEnterpriseLmsBlendedLearningSession.IRe.description: Request parameters for filtering and paginating blended learning sessions.

id.description: Primary Key - unique identifier of the blended learning session.

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization owning this session.

session_type.description: Type of session (e.g., online, offline, hybrid).

title.description: Title or name of the blended learning session.

description.description: Detailed description of the session; may be null if not provided.

status.description: Current status of the session (e.g., scheduled, completed, cancelled).

scheduled_start_at.description: Scheduled start date and time of the session.

scheduled_end_at.description: Scheduled end date and time, if known (nullable).

actual_end_at.description: Actual end date and time of the session (nullable).

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the record was last updated.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.

IEnterpriseLmsBlendedLearningSession.description: Blended learning session entity representing a combined online and offline instructional session within a tenant organization. Includes metadata fields for session type, title, status, schedule timestamps, and audit information. Soft deletion is supported to mark inactive sessions without removing them physically.

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization owning this session.

session_type.description: Type of session (e.g., online, offline, hybrid).

title.description: Title or name of the blended learning session.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the session.

status.description: Initial status of the session (e.g., scheduled).

scheduled_start_at.description: Scheduled start date and time of the session.

scheduled_end_at.description: Scheduled end date and time of the session (nullable).

actual_start_at.description: Actual start date and time of the session (nullable).

actual_end_at.description: Actual end date and time of the session (nullable).

IEnterpriseLmsBlendedLearningSession.ICr.description: Request body for creating a new blended learning session. Includes necessary fields such as tenant ID, session type, title, status, and scheduling timestamps. Optional descriptive fields can be provided. Soft deletion timestamp is not allowed in creation.

session_type.description: Type of session (e.g., online, offline, hybrid).

title.description: Title or name of the blended learning session.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the session.

status.description: Current status of the session (e.g., scheduled, completed, cancelled).

scheduled_start_at.description: Scheduled start date and time of the session.

scheduled_end_at.description: Scheduled end date and time of the session (nullable).

actual_start_at.description: Actual start date and time of the session (nullable).

actual_end_at.description: Actual end date and time of the session (nullable).

IEnterpriseLmsBlendedLearningSession.IUp.description: Request body for updating a blended learning session. Contains optional modifiable fields such as session type, title, description, status, and scheduling timestamps.

IEnterpriseLmsAssessments.IRequest.description: Request type for searching and pagination of assessments in Enterprise LMS. Allows filtering by tenant, status, type, and scheduling dates with pagination and sorting.

tenant_id.description: Filter by tenant organization ID

code.description: Partial match for assessment code

status.description: Filter by status

scheduled_start_after.description: Filtering by scheduled start date, ISO 8601 format

scheduled_end_before.description: Filtering by scheduled end date, ISO 8601 format

limit.description: Page size limit for pagination

_none_.description: Explicit null value used for no additional filter

_null_.description: Explicit null value used for no value

IEnterpriseLmsAssessments.description: Represents an assessment entity in the Enterprise LMS, capturing diverse metadata including tenant association, codes, titles, assessment type, scoring thresholds, schedule, status, and lifecycle management timestamps.

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization owning this assessment

code.description: Unique business code identifying the assessment

scheduled_end_at.description: Scheduled end datetime for the assessment

status.description: Current status of the assessment such as planned, active, completed, or cancelled

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp, null if not deleted

code.description: Unique business code identifying the assessment

Page number.
Used for paginating search results, defaults to the first page if omitted.

Limitation of records per a page.
Defines how many questions will be returned in a single paginated response. Defaults to 100.

Optional search keyword for question text.
Enables filtering questions by matching this keyword within their text content.

Optional filter by question type.

Limits questions to those associated with a specific assessment UUID.

Optional sorting parameters.
Defines the ordering of returned questions, e.g., by creation date.

Primary Key.
Represents the unique identifier for each assessment question within the system.

question_type.description: Type of question such as multiple choice, true/false, essay, practical. Determines the format and response type expected for the question.

weight.description: Weight or points this question contributes to total assessment score. Floating-point number indicating the question's score weight.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp, null if not deleted.

weight.description: Weight of the question contributing to the total score.

IEnterpriseLmsForum.IRequest.description: Request type for paginated, filtered, possibly sorted list search requests for forums. Supports tenant scoping, search terms, and pagination parameters. Used in APIs that return a filtered list of forums.

owner_id.description: Owner user ID, typically organization admin managing this forum (UUID). Used for access control and auditing.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Reflects most recent changes.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active. Used to logically delete forums without removing data.

IEnterpriseLmsForum.description: The Forum entity type returned by API responses. Represents full forum records from database including audit timestamps.

owner_id.description: Owner user ID who manages this forum. Must be a valid UUID.

name.description: Name of the forum. Must be unique within the tenant. Maximum length typically as per database constraints.

description.description: Optional forum description to explain the forum's purpose.

IEnterpriseLmsForums.ICreate.description: Request type used when creating a new forum entity. Only necessary properties that client must provide are included.

id.description: Unique identifier of the forum entity (UUID).

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization owning this forum.

description.description: Optional forum description.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the forum was last updated.

Optional. Must be unique within tenant scope.

deleted_at.description: Optional soft delete timestamp. Setting a date marks the forum as deleted.

IEnterpriseLmsForums.IUpdate.description: Update properties for an EnterpriseLms forum. Allows modifying forum name, description, and soft-deletion timestamp. All fields are optional except ID (which is path parameter outside this interface).

page.description: Optional pagination page number (default first page).

limit.description: Optional number of items per page (default configurable).

search.description: Optional full-text search string to filter by thread title or body.

sort.description: Optional sort order, e.g., "created_at DESC" or "title ASC".

IEnterpriseLmsForumThreads.IRequest.description: Request body for searching and filtering forum threads. Supports pagination, sorting, search criteria. All properties optional.

id.description: Primary Key.

forum_id.description: Forum to which this thread belongs.

author_id.description: User who created the thread (content creator/instructor).

body.description: Initial post content or thread description.

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp.

IEnterpriseLmsForumThread.description:
Represents discussion threads inside a forum. Threads belong to a forum
and have an author. Threads support soft deletion and track their
creation and update timestamps. This entity enables discussion grouping
under forums.

forum_id.description: Identifier of the forum this thread belongs to.

author_id.description: Identifier of the author (content creator/instructor) creating this thread.

body.description: Optional thread initial body post content.

IEnterpriseLmsForumThread.ICreate.description: Body for creating a new forum thread. Requires forum_id, author_id, and title. Optional body content allowed.

forum_id.description: Forum to which this thread belongs.

author_id.description: User who created the thread (content creator/instructor).

body.description: Initial post content or thread description.

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp.

IEnterpriseLmsForumThread.IUpdate.description: Update request body for a forum thread.

id.description: Primary Key.

author_id.description: User who authored the post (corporate learner or instructor).

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp.

IEnterpriseLmsForumPost.description:
Forum post entity representing individual posts inside forum threads.

Each post includes body, author info, timestamps, and supports soft deletion for audit and compliance.

Forum thread association ensures posts are linked to valid discussion threads.

author_id.description: User who authored the post (corporate learner or instructor).

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp.

oneOf.description: Current page number.
Limitation of records per a page.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

oneOf.description: Sorting rule for the list.

IEnterpriseLmsForumPost.IRequest.description: Request object for filtered paginated list of forum posts.

author_id.description: User who authored the post (corporate learner or instructor).

IEnterpriseLmsForumPost.ICreate.description:
Payload to create a new forum post within a forum thread.

Includes thread linkage, author, and post content.

No timestamps or IDs are submitted; they are generated by the system.

author_id.description: User who authored the post (corporate learner or instructor).

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp.

IEnterpriseLmsForumPost.IUpdate.description:
Payload for updating an existing forum post.

Fields are optional to support partial update semantics.

Includes thread and author references, post content, and delete flag.

id.description: Primary Key.

tenant_id.description: Tenant owning the message.

sender_id.description: User who sent the message (any user role).

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp.

IEnterpriseLmsDirectMessage.description:
Direct message entity representing private messages exchanged between users.

Includes sender, recipient, content, timestamps, and soft deletion.

Ensures tenant-level data isolation and secure communication.

tenant_id.description: Tenant owning the message.

sender_id.description: User who sent the message (any user role).

limit.description: Pagination limit per page.

IEnterpriseLmsDirectMessage.IRequest.description:
Request parameters for searching and filtering direct messages.

Supports filtering by sender, recipient, message content, sent time range.

Includes pagination parameters to control the size and page of results.

tenant_id.description: Tenant owning the message.

sender_id.description: User who sent the message (any user role).

IEnterpriseLmsDirectMessage.ICreate.description:
Payload to create a new direct message entity.

Includes tenant, sender, recipient, content, and sent timestamp.

body.description: Content body of the message. Allows updating the text of the direct message.

read_at.description: Timestamp when the message was read. Nullable to unset the read status.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp. Nullable to unset deletion.

IEnterpriseLmsDirectMessage.IUpdate.description: Request body for updating a direct message. Represents modifiable fields including message body and read timestamp.

oneOf.description: Search keyword. Optional text filter for virtual classroom content.

search.description: Search keyword. Optional text filter for virtual classroom content.

oneOf.description: Current page number. Unsigned 32-bit integer.
Number of records per page. Defaults to 100 if omitted.

limit.description: Number of records per page. Defaults to 100 if omitted.

oneOf.description: Sort order. Possible values: "asc" or "desc".
Sort order. Possible values: "asc" or "desc".
Filter by instructor ID. Should be a UUID formatted string if provided.

instructor_id.description: Filter by instructor ID. Should be a UUID formatted string if provided.

oneOf.description: Status filter. Examples include "scheduled", "completed", "cancelled".

status.description: Status filter. Examples include "scheduled", "completed", "cancelled".

IEnterpriseLmsVirtualClassroom.IRequest.description: Request body for paginated search of virtual classrooms. Supports filtering and pagination parameters.

id.description: Unique identifier for the virtual classroom session

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization ID

title.description: Title of the virtual classroom session

description.description: Optional session description

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp

IEnterpriseLmsVirtualClassroom.description: Virtual classroom session entity within the Enterprise LMS platform representing scheduled live training events with tenant ownership, instructor, scheduling, status, and audit timestamps.

tenant_id.description: Tenant organization ID.

title.description: Title of the virtual classroom session.

description.description: Optional session description.

IEnterpriseLmsVirtualClassroom.ICreate.description: Request body for creating a new virtual classroom session within the Enterprise LMS platform.

title.description: Title of the virtual classroom session

description.description: Optional description of the session

IEnterpriseLmsVirtualClassroom.IUpdate.description: Payload to update an existing virtual classroom session. All fields are optional.

limit.description: Maximum number of records per page

search.description: Optional search term to filter group projects

IEnterpriseLmsGroupProject.IRequest.description:
Request payload for searching and paginating group projects.

Supports optional pagination parameters (page, limit), search terms, and sorting keys.

id.description: Primary Key of the group project

tenant_id.description: Tenant owning the project

owner_id.description: Owner user of the project (corporate learner or instructor)

description.description: Optional description of the project

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp

owner.description: Owner user entity representing the project lead.

IEnterpriseLmsGroupProject.description:
Represents a collaborative group project workspace within the Enterprise LMS.

Projects are tenant-scoped and have an owner user who manages the project. They have titles, optional descriptions, start and end dates, and soft delete support.

Used to enable teamwork and group collaboration among corporate learners.

tenant_id.description: Tenant owning the project

owner_id.description: Owner user of the project (corporate learner or instructor)

description.description: Optional description of the project

IEnterpriseLmsGroupProject.ICreate.description:
Payload to create a new group project workspace for tenant collaboration.

Includes fields for tenant ID, owner user ID, title, optional description, and project duration timestamps.

Used to initiate new collaborative learning projects within the enterprise LMS.

IEnterpriseLmsGroupProject.IUpdate.description:
Payload to update details of a group project.

Allows modification of timeline and descriptive fields while preserving ownership information.

description.description: Optional detailed description

tenant_id.description: Tenant ID filter for announcements (UUID)

status.description: Filter by status

limit.description: Pagination limit of items per page

IEnterpriseLmsAnnouncement.IRequest.description: Search and pagination parameters for tenant announcements

id.description: Unique identifier for the announcement.

tenant_id.description: Tenant identifier owning this announcement.

target_audience_description.description:
Description of the target audience for the announcement.

Optional field describing who is targeted.

status.description:
The current status of the announcement, e.g. 'draft', 'sent', 'archived'.

Must be an exact allowed string value.

created_at.description:
Creation timestamp of the announcement.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string.

updated_at.description:
Last update timestamp.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string.

deleted_at.description:
Optional soft deletion timestamp.

Null means active; ISO 8601 datetime if deleted.

IEnterpriseLmsAnnouncement.description:
Announcement messages sent to groups within tenants. Announcements have a
title, body, target audience description, and status tracking including
pipeline status such as draft, sent, or archived. They support soft deletion
and timestamps for creation and update. Announcements help communicate important information across the enterprise LMS ecosystem.

tenant_id.description: Tenant identifier owning the announcement.

target_audience_description.description:
Description of the target audience for the announcement.

Optional and nullable.

status.description:
Status must be set explicitly.
Required string denoting announcement state.

IEnterpriseLmsAnnouncement.ICreate.description:
Request body for creating a new announcement record within a tenant organization.

Includes title, body, target audience, and pipeline status.

Tenant ID and creator ID are required for attribution and security.

target_audience_description.description: Description of the target audience for the announcement, optional

status.description: Status of the announcement, e.g., 'draft', 'sent', 'archived'

IEnterpriseLmsAnnouncement.IUpdate.description: Update an existing announcement by its unique identifier within the enterprise LMS tenant context. It modifies forum metadata such as name and description, ensuring the tenant and owner associations remain consistent. The operation updates the 'enterprise_lms_announcements' table, enforcing unique name constraints per tenant and preserving data isolation. Authorization to modify is restricted to organization administrators maintaining security and correct ownership.

search.description: Optional search term for filtering enrollments

status.description: Optional status filter for enrollment status

limit.description: Limit of records per page (uint32)

learner_id.description: Optionally filter by learner ID UUID

learning_path_id.description: Optionally filter by learning path ID UUID

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollment.IRequest.description:
Retrieves a filtered, sorted, and paginated list of learner enrollments for learning paths.

The operation accepts extensive search criteria in the request body such as learner identification, learning path filters, enrollment status, date range filtering, and paging options.

Security controls ensure that returned data is scoped to the requesting user's permissions, preventing exposure of enrollments from other tenants.

The response includes a paginated list of enrollments summarized with essential properties for display in management UIs or reporting tools.

This API supports efficient querying of enrollment data to facilitate administrative actions and learner progress monitoring.

id.description: Primary Key. UUID string identifying the enrollment

status.description: Current enrollment status such as 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled'

updated_at.description: Record last update timestamp ISO 8601 string

deleted_at.description: Optional soft delete timestamp

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollment.description: This table records enrollment information for learners in courses and programs within the LMS. It links learners to learning paths or courses, enforcing prerequisite validations and status tracking. Includes soft deletion support, creation, and update timestamps.

status.description: Current enrollment status

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollment.ICreate.description: Create a new enrollment record for a learner into a learning path within the enterprise LMS. Accepts learner ID, learning path ID, status, and optional business status for lifecycle control.

id.description: Primary Key.

prerequisite_course_id.description: Prerequisite course's enterprise_lms_contents.id to be completed before enrollment.

created_at.description: Creation time for this prerequisite link.

updated_at.description: Last update time for this record.

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollmentPrerequisite.description:
Represents an enrollment prerequisite which specifies the courses that must be completed before enrollment can proceed.

Every record uniquely identifies the prerequisite and links it to a specific enrollment and course.

This ensures consistency and validation of learner progress before allowing enrollment continuation.

Includes timestamps to support audit and business rule enforcement.

enrollment_id.description:
Belonged enrollment's enterprise_lms_enrollments.id.

Specifies the enrollment record this prerequisite applies to.

prerequisite_course_id.description:
Prerequisite course's enterprise_lms_contents.id to be completed before

Enrollment progression requires satisfying this prerequisite.

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollmentPrerequisite.ICr.description:
Request body schema for creating a new enrollment prerequisite.

Includes references to the enrollment and the prerequisite course involved in the requirement.

limit.description:
Number of records to return per page.

@default 20

sort.description: Optional sort order, e.g. 'created_at asc' or 'created_at desc'.

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollmentPrerequisite.IRe.description:
Request body for searching enrollment prerequisite records.

Supports pagination, sorting, and filtering by enrollment or prerequisite course IDs.

learner_id.description: The ID of the learner associated with this enrollment. Must correspond to an existing learner UUID in the system.

learning_path_id.description: The ID of the learning path this enrollment belongs to. Must correspond to an existing learning path UUID.

status.description: Specifies the current enrollment status such as 'active', 'completed', or 'cancelled'. This controls the learner's progression state.

business_status.description: Optional business workflow state indicating special conditions or approvals related to this enrollment.

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the last update to this record in ISO 8601 format.

deleted_at.description: Optional soft delete timestamp indicating when the record was logically deleted.

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollment.IUpdate.description:
This schema defines the update payload for modifying an existing Enrollment record within the Enterprise LMS. Properties are optional, allowing partial updates. It excludes creating or mandatory identity fields, which are managed internally or via authentication context.

All date-time fields must conform to ISO 8601 standard.

Business logic on statuses and enrollment state transitions should be enforced server-side.

id.description: Primary Key of the record.

prerequisite_course_id.description: Prerequisite course's enterprise_lms_contents.id to be completed before enrollment.

created_at.description: Creation time for this prerequisite link.

updated_at.description: Last update time for this record.

IEnterpriseLmsEnrollmentPrerequisite.IUp.description:
Update data for an enrollment prerequisite. The id property is mandatory to identify the record.

Other properties are optional and can be modified individually.

All updates must maintain data integrity and tenancy isolation.

IEnterpriseLmsContentAccessControl.description: Content access control rules assigning visibility and permissions to learners and user roles. It restricts content access by tenant, department, role, and individual learner with auditing timestamps.

tenant_id.description: Belonged tenant's enterprise_lms_tenants.id.

IEnterpriseLmsContentAccessControl.ICrea.description: Content access control entry creation data.

Comma-separated allowed roles like 'corporateLearner,externalLearner'.

Compliant with roles in the Enterprise LMS system for content access control.

Properties are optional and nullable to permit clearing access lists.
